dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Parsons? And Peter? They know. And that girl in the hospital will never forget your face. You miscalculated, now you pay. Patience tested, he suddenly WHACKS her across the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate a bad bluffer. She makes a big effort to hide how much that stung.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure hope that felt good because you can't afford too many more signs of struggle. Can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, hit me back. It's what you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's what you want me to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to profiling, huh? Your thought process is completely transparent. And now Miranda briefly takes the reins of the conversation. Analyst and patient in session.      Echoin her opening scene with Chloe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we're even. You left that door open so I'd try and run, it's what you get off on, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we'll find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And yet you have to make me look like a suicide. With what, your belt? (off his shrug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How would I get access to a belt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, prisoners hang themselves with just about anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that's going to satisfy you. You won't be able to do this clean. You have too much guilt inside. SMACK! Another slap across the face. Miranda's knees buckle. But she remains standing. Her lip trembles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're losing grasp of the situation. It was different with those girls. I bet all they did was cry and scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, you'll scream. (after a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take off your shirt. This throws her off.     She shoots a quick glance at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't I a little old for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it off. She hesitates.    He draws his gun, tired.    Removes the safety.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's for show. You know you can't shoot me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I can smash your teeth out and make it look like you bashed your head against the wall. Now shut up, take off your goddamn shirt and pull off your bra.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Miranda is petrified now.      Running out of ways to hid it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today, Doctor. In a sudden move, Miranda shoves the chair at him and bolts out the door. The Sheriff doesn't move to stop her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda dashes down the hallway, trying to escape. Takes quick inventory of the space: two more holding cells like her own, a row of filing cabinets, and a storage area with barred windows. She makes a turn up ahead and reaches another gate down the corridor. A sliding gate that closes off the cell area from the main station. She tries the gate. Locked, naturally.       She shakes a bangs on it, desperate.

dialogues.speaker: TURLINGTON
dialogues.text: No response. And no way to disguise the sheer panic in her voice. She fell for his trap. They're all alone here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan smiles at that. Re-holsters his weapon and walks towards her, taking his time. Relishing the hunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug mentioned you were painfully 'modest.' But enough about you, let's discuss Rachel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Miranda searches for a place to hide.        His FOOT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was no crippled saint. Wasn't the first time she turned up at Doug's house all messed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Ryan peeks down the corridor where we last saw Miranda. The gate still locked. She's not there. He traces her steps, clearly enjoying this: SHERIFF RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure she was a minor, but she wasn't going to let that get in her way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda is cramped underneath an upturned desk. The SHOT is FRAMED so we can see the doorway. She prays silently: MIRANDA (sotto)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rachel, where are you when I need you? Clearly not here.   Sheriff Ryan's voice getting closer: SHERIFF RYAN (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those other girls -- make no mistake -- they knew what they were getting into. He appears at the doorway now, peeks inside the room. Sensing her in there. Miranda holds her breath. SHERIFF RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not saying they knew they were going to die, but truth is, Doug and I didn't know it was going to end that way. It was just the natural extension of that moment. So yeah, we fucked them and we killed them. And we knew it was wrong. Sure we did. He reaches the upturned desk and flips it over with a CLANGING SOUND. Miranda wasn't underneath that one. She scrambles to the door behind him as he turns --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slams the door shut on his fingers and fumbles to slide the deadbolt behind her when the door suddenly SMASHES OPEN against her, knocking her backwards onto the floor -- He looms over her. She reaches around for anything to defend herself. Nothing there. Game over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't some satanic pact, society didn't make us do it. But I believe given the proper circumstances a person is capable of anything -- certainly in my line of work you see it day in, day out. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what, keep the shirt. The bra will do. Miranda stares, helpless. The Sheriff gestures for her to begin. Like he has all the time in the world. Miranda slides up the wall and starts to unclasp her bra under her shirt. Petrified --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chin up, Doctor. You wanted to get to the bottom of this and you did. You followed it all the way through. This is how it ends. His demeanor and voice are eerily calm,    as if in a trance. He takes the bra from her hand     and hangs it around her neck, as if helping somebody    with their tie She takes a step back and finds herself    pinned against the wall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug settled down once you two got married. New start and all that. Wanted nothing to do with this runaway I'd found, Tracy Seaver -- He squeezes the bra tightly around her throat, choking her. She stares straight into his eyes -- her whole body simultaneously frozen in place and shaking uncontrollably --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or so he claimed. Because the truth, Doc -- is people never change. The son of a bitch couldn't resist. I asked him to dump the body and instead he went found some barn to work her out of his system some more. Go fucking figure. And now we PAN DOWN TO see Miranda's left hand ever so slowly reach for his holster...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't count on anyone, even friends you've had your whole life. They're so close together their noses nearly touch. He gazes into her eyes, watching life drain out of her. He applies one final burst of pressure, stretching her skin to the point of no return --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only soul you can ever count on is yourself -- BLAM! A GUNSHOT rings out and half his ear explodes in a gush of blood. He stumbles back, still on his feet, dazed. He looks up at Miranda with the gun trained on him. Struggling to catch her breath. A faint smile forms on his lips, somehow appreciative of this turn of events.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, Doctor.   That was unexpected. He steps forward, almost playfully. She slowly shakes her head. Wraps her fingers tightly around the trigger --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure about this? He stares at her. Blood flowing from the side of his head. He's now standing directly in front of Miranda's open cell, weighing his options at triple speed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need me alive for your story to stick. Be logical now. You know you can't kill me. He takes exactly half a step forward when Miranda drills a BULLET through his forehead. Sheriff Ryan splays backwards and lands with a crash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Logic is overrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to Tracy's room is closed. WE FIND Pete where we left him, by the soda machine, fighting to stay awake.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MOVING TOWARD him, we COME TO REST ON the back of his neck. So TIGHT we can actually see the hairs on the back of his neck. And as he feels the SWOOSH of a cold whisper, they stand up on their ends. Pete turns to Tracy's room to notice that the door is now open. Strange. He stands up and walks to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete looks oddly around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody in here -- ? As he turns, we REVEAL Rachel slipping out of the room. Unseen by him, of course. Pete starts to exit when Tracy opens her eyes. Groggily waking as if from a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turlington comes out of his cruiser, carrying a bag of take-out food. Chatting with his colleagues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turlington raps on the Sheriff's door and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Ryan? No sight of the man.  That's odd. Maybe he's in the bathroom. Turlington heads in that direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turlington peeks in.      checks the stalls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff? Nobody. He notices the back window is open because raindrops are blown in by the wind. He looks out to the parking lot for a moment before shutting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FRONT DESK OFFICER is trying to hold back a grim Pete Parsons and Teddy Howard from heading to the back area. FRONT DESK OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but nobody is allowed to visit at this hour -- PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the Sheriff here or isn't he? OFFICER TURLINGTON (reaching the scene)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help you, gentlemen? PETE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here to see Miranda Grey. OFFICER TURLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know full well you're not allowed to see -- Teddy Howard slaps an official-looking document on him. TEDDY HOWARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's straight from Judge Wilkinson. Take us to her cell. FRONT DESK OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better get the Sheriff out here. Turlington looks over the paperwork, confused. OFFICER TURLINGTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Ryan isn't here. His car is gone too. PARSONS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer, unlock the goddamn door to Miranda's cell or I'll break it down myself. Turlington is not used to being spoken to this way, certainly not by upstanding directors of psychiatric institutes. He leads the men down the corridor and unlocks the cell. The men wait as all three locks are dutifully undone and then the heavy door is slid open. The men look inside and instantly stop in their tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheriff Ryan, splayed.   Very dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus H. Christ. Teddy Howard has to look away. Pete places his hand on Parsons' shoulder. Parsons simply glares at the dead man, eyes filled with hatred. No sign of Miranda anywhere.        Vanished.   Like Houd

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA SOARS THROUGH the tall gates, PAST the guard, PAST the sprinklers watering the impressive gardens. A TAXICAB pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE
dialogues.text: A healthier, much happier-looking Chloe shakes Pete's hand at the front steps. Small suitcase by her side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for everything, Dr. Graham. I'll never forget all you've done for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been my pleasure, Miss McGrath. Good luck out there. Chloe smiles.     Awkward.   Her first day out in the rea world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess this is it. I hope not to see you again unless it's for coffee or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you never know. It's a small world, unless you have to clean it. Chloe picks up her bag, climbs down the steps to her cab. Stops midway, turns:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to tell me if you don't want to, but -- have you ever heard anything from -- ? Pete shakes his head. Chloe nods, climbs inside the cab. Pete waves as it drives off. Then he pulls out a postcard from his pocket. It has a New York City postmark.

dialogues.speaker: POSTCARD
dialogues.text: MIRANDA (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Pete. Hope this finds you on both feet, preferably having been promoted to director after Phil's retirement. Not that you had much competition, but a big hug to you anyway... I was as surprised as anyone to read about Sheriff Ryan's suicide and the startling discovery that it was he who murdered my late husband. I wish I could personally thank certain people for their convincing testimonies in the case.

dialogues.speaker: NEWSPAPER HEADLINES
dialogues.text: fly AT us under her V.O.: A) "Female doctor still at large, wanted for questioning," with a picture of Miranda underneath. B) "Guilt-ridden serial killer killed accomplice, then killed self: Female Doctor cleared on charges." Pictures of Sheriff Ryan and Douglas Grey side by side. C) "Authorities close case on dual serial killers: community mourns murdered daughters." A picture of Officer Turlington, Pete, and Phil Parsons at a press conference. MIRANDA (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As for myself, I have a new name now and a job working with teenage girls at a runaway shelter, trying to keep an open mind at the horrors they tell me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM DOWN TO a young woman kneeling down to set flowers on a grave and we recognize her as Tracy Seaver. Shockingly cleaned up and properly attired -- she's even cute. MIRANDA (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which reminds me: Consuelo the Cuban witch is a keeper, don't fire her. She knows things about the world you and I don't.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to see the gave is Rachel's, and it is positively overflowing with flowers. She's become something of a cause celeb in these parts. Tracy walks back to the retired couple holding hands, Phil and Dorothy Parsons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, gotta run now, I have some country songs to write and lots of social invites to decline... STILL PULLING BACK THROUGH the lush cemetery, PAST several trees until we find Rachel watching the serene scene. She turns TO CAMERA now and we PUSH INTO her eyes, finally at peace, until it FILLS the SCREEN and in it we see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miranda walking among the throng of pedestrians. She looks confident, relaxed, down to earth. No longer the tightly wound professional at the beginning of our story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.S. And in case you're wondering what the chances are of me buying you a beer and maybe finishing something we almost started, the answer is: it's just not going to happen. Especially not at McSorley's next Friday night. Say around nine. So you probably shouldn't bother showing up. All my love, M.G. She turns at the light and gets lost in the crowd.
